I got it to work by re-using the old crack that came with the original game release. The game runs, but it seems to crash really fast while playing.
I'll try your method and let you know if it worked.

Ok, now I got it to work with this crack. Here's how:
1. Install the game using the original release, but DO NOT use the crack supplied in that release.
2. Run twice the 'gu.exe' file to update the game to 1.02. The game will try to start after each update. Don't worry when it fails.
3. Copy the files supplied in this 1.2 crack release to the proper dirs (it will overwrite existing files).
4. Run the game via the Heroes VI file (not the game launcher). It will ask for Ubisoft user and password. Enter them, or create one if you don't have it.
5. After successful login, the game will ask for beta serial number. Just write a few letters (I wrote 'dsfsdf'), and continue. It will switch to a different screen.
6. Click 'Play'. When the game loads, it will try to connect to Conflux. Just click the 'X' at the top right.

* Note that the game tends to crash. A lot.

Following loadstone007 and Anand_C_S instructions, I was able to start single player campaign. I updated game twice, and it patched without any error messages. I'm halfway through first scenario in tutorial campaign, and the game didn't crash even once.
Only serious glitch is that when you alt+tab out and back into the game, game seem to be working, but there is only black screen on my AMD radeon card, so "end process" was needed.

Hi
The crack is working allright but in the game there are some strange things - like you can only play multiplayer with Heaven, Necropolis and Sanctuary. No way of playing for Inferno or the Horde.
Is it normal? Or is it some way to fix it?
IF U GET the error message saying you need to verify your connection when clicking gu.exe, you have to go to C:\Windows\system32\drivers\etc and delete or cut the "hosts" file
This thing worked for me, but you should update (gu.exe) non-cracked game, just after normal installer. Also I could run homm.exe only from administrator. But it works (and craches sometimes).
